sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
There are 20 members on a student council in a school and the ratio of the number of boys to the number of girls is \(1 : 1 \). How many more girls should be added to the council so that the ratio of number of boys to the girls become \(10 : 29 \).
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{Sum of the terms of the ratio is $ = 1 + 1 = 2 $}$$"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, number of boys in the council is}$$ 
\[
	= \frac{1 }{2 } \times 20 = 10.0 
\] "}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, the number of girls in the council is}$$
\[
	= \frac{1 }{2 } \times 20 = 10.0 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{Let $x$ be the number of girls that should be added to the student council. Now, number of girls is $ = 10.0 + x $}$$"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, according to given information, we can write that}$$
\[
	\frac{10.0 }{10.0 + x } = \frac{10 }{29 }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "\[\Rightarrow 290.0 = 100.0 + 10 x\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow 190.0 = 10 x
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow x = 19 
\]
$$\text{This is the number of girls that needs to be added.}$$"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Sum of the terms of the ratio is the sum of the two parts of the ratio, i.e., $1 + 1 = 2$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{We know that the ratio of boys to girls in the council is $1 : 1$.Therefore, the fraction of boys in the council is $1 / (1 + 1)$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{The ratio of boys to girls in the council is $1 : 1$.Similarly, the fraction of girls in the council is $1 / (1 + 1)$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{After adding $x$ girls, the total number of girls in the council will be $10.0 + x$.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{According to the problem, the ratio of boys to girls in the council will remain the same after adding $x$ girls. Therefore, we can set up an equation}$
	\frac{10.0 }{10.0 + x } = \frac{10 }{29 } $ $$\text{using the ratios before and after adding $x$ girls.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Cross-multiplying the fractions and simplifying, we get $290.0 = 100.0 + 10 x $ } "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon simplifying the equation, we get $190.0 = 10 x $}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification we get the value of $x = 19$.}$$"}]
